reviews.text: The view from on top of the bridge is nice. You get to know the structure better. However, it is a bit noisy and unfortunately you cannot see downtown Lisbon from up there. It would be very nice around the sunset time.

one of the most wonderful bridges in the world! in my opinion. look up the name and learn something about the revolution!
and: its LONGER (not higher though) than Golden Gate Bridge, (-sorry SF), but true.
It gives you a beautiful view of the Tagus estuary, and the other margin. Nice place to see the sunset from both margins.

Old Bridge but a mark of Portugal engineering from the dictatorship the rebranded bridge to celebrate Portugal end of dictatorship is a San Francisco golden bridge twin sister and it looks as good looking as its counterpart.
Really helpful when you need to cross the Tagus River as many people do to work daily or just as a tourist, it receives some running competitions which is just amazing run on this bridge the only warning is becarful with the wind this area is windy

Pilar 7 has an elevator to learn the history of the bridge, get a close up view of the cables that suspend the bridge, and get a view of Lisbon and the South shore from road level of the bridge.  There is a glass floored platform if you are not afraid of heights.

If you are willing to visit the historical place, I must suggest you to be here. I really found this place amazing. Full of crowds, musics, small shops and the sea side. 

I must say, Summer is the best time to visit this place. Though there is always a crowd. I, personally suggest you to come here and enjoy your time. :)

This place surprised me, it's really incredible. It is preceded by a Great boulevard full of many shops. bakeries sell all The typical sweets of the region. all super rich and fresh. Many artists on the street with good shows

Big space right on the side of the river Tagus. This is great place to come and just people watch to your heart's content. Restaurants are located on the side of the square so if you need to rest, there are plenty of options. This is also a place where you can catch public transit that can take you up the river (east) or go towards Belem (west).  The only issue I have with the place was the amount of wind which was brisk at times.
Has lovely places lined up, where u get great food, drinks,snacks and awesome view. Ok vendors pass by trying to sell you sun glasses and offer even drugs. But all in all, great place😍
Beautiful historical place. In the night or during the day. Lot of history to learn. You can imagine how it was in the Discovery times. Awesome

Apparently one of the students that eventually came on to contribute to the Eiffel Tower started with this as one of his pet projects. Apparently at the top there supposed to be a nice view, however it is always a wait with many tourists and so unless you have time to spare this may not be worthwhile for you. There are plenty of other places from which you can also get a great view of Lisbon which wouldn't cost as much time or money.

Very popular to tourists. It's an historic place. It has interesting history. You'll love when you enter the lift and reach the roof top. You'll see an unforgettable view of Lisbon!!!! From there you can see the whole Lisbon city!!!! It's amazing, isn't it? For the elevator ride you've to buy a ticket which is 5 or 10 euro. I forget the price. But I'll bet you can enjoy.

Great views. Tip: get a 1 day travel card from the Metro station. It's valid for trams, metro and buses and the elevator, which still is legally public transport... You will have to pay a small amount (about €1.50 I think) to get onto the viewing platform but you won't need to fork out €5.30  for the lift. And do go early in the day to avoid long queues.

Pleasant to look at but I done think it is worth the money or the time to wait for your turn. The city contains much better viewpoints than this. Beside taking the lift, You can go through the stairs up but to go to the highest point you have to pay a little amount of fee which is already included if you bought the lift ticket.

The lift is beautiful from outside. The interior is not as good as expected. But it gives an amazing view if you go on the top. On one side, you can find the Ocean, on the other side you can find the systematic placement of the houses and the statues. Lisbon is a very well planned city.

Let's be honest, this collection can't be compared to Hermitage or Prado or Louvre. 
It is small, nicely curated museum with Portuguese art, furniture and some ceramics and some international art as well.
Most famous of pieces there is Bosch and Breugel. But other pieces worth attention as well.
1-2 hours is enough for the visit.

The gardens and view are amazing. 
Went on a visit and had the most amazing guide (his name was Davide Camilo) and he was professional, pedagogical, attentive and thoughtful. Caught him on his last day though 🙁 if all guides are like him, totally recommend the experience, it really makes a difference walking with someone that knows the history of the exhibit/artist/collection.
Anyway, the place it's a plus in the city 😁
Very nice collections. I enjoyed the furniture collections. Such wonderful inlays. Worth a visit.
Good array of art work. No masterpiece. Not exactly antiquity in Western standard. Nice garden outside the cafe. Make sure u get your food before tour group arrive. we

The exhibits (that were open) are very well curated and beautifully displayed. However, more than 1/3 of the museum is roped off with no explanation, yet they are still charging full admission. We asked 2 staff members ( in Portuguese) when the room with the exhibit we specifically came to see will be open and one just laughed and replied "who knows", the other shrugged and said "maybe Tuesday, maybe June". If they are going to have rolling closures they should at least put a schedule on their site or in the lobby.

Amazing place. Almost like a Disney castle on the outside. Wonderful tile work and interesting period restoration. A bit of a walk up hill but we'll with it. Buy your tickets online ahead of time and get the early for the least waiting time for the bus uphill.

One of the best viewpoints! You can see the entire city and feel like you are going back in time, in the medieval era. A good part of the castle wall is preserved and the modern touch with the periscope replacing the archive tower is awesome. You can have a 360° of the surroundings and never leave the "Camera Obscura".
It' s definitely worth visiting!

Amazing views of the city with an equally amazing walk through the grounds of a castle. We went on the weekend so it was a bit crowded which made the rampart walks a little less ideal, but still worth it. I would also recommend if you come here to stop for a bite at Conqvistador, it's just down an alley right by the ticket office and easy to miss. Look for the sign that says fast way to city center and it's just down there.

This is a nice piece of history in the old part of Lisbon.  If you are a history buff.  If not than this might not be the place for you.  The upside there is a restaurant hidden in the back over looking the city with nice views and wine.  I didn't try the food but it looked good.

A nice touristic attraction worth seeing if you are willing to pay 10 euros for an adult. Has a nice view of the city, but again there are many free places provide that. If you are planning to walk up, it might be hard for elderly people or people with children. Have a nice time!

One of the best viewpoints of Lisbon. A nice, little park and a fantastic view on the maze of red roofs that form the Alfama-quarter and beyond those roofs the shimmering blue of the Tagus. And if you have sore feet from climbing and descending through the narrow streets then you can let them cool off in the water of the pond.

This the place to take in wondeful views. Stumbled upon this wonderful terrace. For even better views you can go up the stairs and enjoy a coffee at the restaurant there. Or bring a drink and watch the sunset and take great photos of a sunset. It can be a bit busy though.

What an incredible and beautiful place! Fantastic historical significance; where the Portuguese Soldiers Stood their ground against the Moors fight their battles and chased the occupying forces of the Moorish army and their king, thus liberated the city and returning it back to its citizens. Amazing skill and real battle tactics with positive results!
Amazing and unforgettable views of the city from here, you’ll definitely be making special and unforgettable memories in this very special place. Definitely worth the walk, ride, street car lift to this place. I would say, a must when visiting Lisboa, Portugal.

We had incredible scenic picturesque views on the day and the street music made it even more special. 
After walking up the steep hill to get there it was fantastic to spend a few minutes thinking and taking time to for yourself. The only disappointing point for this high visited point of interest is the litter. If you visit please take your rubbish with you. 👍

Great view over Lisbon old town. You can also find there some benches to sit and relax while enjoying that beautiful city. To arrive there you have to "climb" a street... It might be a bit difficult but it is worth it.

Great little historical tower. Check out all the carved decorations on pillars in the inner courtyard. They say only 120npeople are allowed in at a time. I know that the traffic lights system controlling the spiral staircase to the top of the tower is not fit for purpose. Apart from that it is a wonderful building but very busy. We took the 15E tram there from Central Lisbon. It was packed. Remember your 50 cent coins for the WC if you can find them. Go back into town for food. There are nice cafes next to McDonald's

This is a landmark in Lisbon, you can get here by public transport from the center and walk a little. The architecture is amazing and this fort has good views at sunset. You can enter but the true splendor is on the outside. There are many tourists in the area and there are other places to see very close.

Beautiful structure and a landmark that should be visited when in Lisbon.  However be prepared for the hundreds of other tourists trying to get a picture.   The lines to get into the structure itself was really long and I didn't try.   Also be aware of all the scanners trying to sell you everything in the world.  Go, take pictures, and leave is my 2cents

This is a nice historical landmark, and one of the most important cultural piece of architecture. I think the story goes that it was once a Sentinel point for the Portuguese Navy. Keep in mind you have to find a way to cross the main streets indirectly, either underground or via Bridge overhead. There is certainly going to be a long line if you want to go into the tower itself, but there are several Vantage points to take good pictures of it all around.

Pro tip: if you are taking the bus, it is not the Belem stop, but rather 3 or so stops further down west.

Belem Tower is worth visiting. Most tourist info site ask you to avoid visiting inside the tower because of the long queues in summer and the limited number of guests allowed in the small tower at any given time. I would agree that waiting an hour or more is not worth it but if the queue is not too bad the tower is well worth it. The highest point gives you a good vantage point to view the entire city. Beautiful pic spot. The spiral to the topmost tower is small and guests are only allowed in one direction at a time. The walls are tiny and the steps steep.

Absolutely amazing. Shows a comprehensive, systemic view of sea activities: navy, merchant, fisheries, dredging... everything under a historical perspective. Don't miss it and don't forget to visit the store. There's a small book store in, small in numbers, but relevant in content.
if you like the sea and the ships - you are definitely here. The exposure is beautiful. models are great. the staff is hospitable and friendly.

Very nice naval museum in Lisbon. It is great to see how much of the Portuguese naval history is interwoven with discovering the spice route to India. A major portion of the history is dedicated to covering this part of their history. Very informative. Highly recommend it. Right next to the Jerónimos Monastery but not as crowded because most tourists probably don't even realize that this is right next to it. In my view, the navel museum was more impressive than the Jerónimos Monastery. I could spend another couple of days here just going over the history and artifacts.
An awesome place, rich in history.  It is meticulously kept, laid out in a very logical sequence.  Only fly in the ointment was the presence of pickpockets, but Security ran the roaches off.

This is a MUST SEE when visiting Lisbon / Belém! We were very impressed with the museum, model ships & royal barges. The history was thorough and you really get a grasp of how the Portuguese pioneered the discovery of new lands and invented navigation hundreds and hundreds of years ago!

Quite a small gallery with one exhibition space and one permanent display. We saw Andrea Romao in the exhibition space, which I loved. The permanent gallery was a thorough description of the periods of modern art, very informative. I would have liked a bit more information about the artists and the pieces but generally really good. It was quiet and peaceful with nice pieces outside too

Impressive museum to say the least. I personally preferred the temporary exhibitions, but the permanent exhibition definitely has its worth as well. The temporary exhibitions are powerful and I especially liked the short movies. The permanent exhibition manages to tell a story and educate it's visitors, while still showing nice pieces.
Went in there to flee from the rain in March. If you like contemporary art, this is a great place to go in Lisbon! The plastics outside are awesome.

If you like modern art, make the time to go here. It's a beautiful building with well curated temporary exhibits. The permanent exhibit wasn't up to the standards of the temp exhibits but was still worth walking through.
Great views. If you like this stuff. Come and enjoy
Beautiful and very nicely kept. Took some amazing photos. We just came across it walking up the hills. Glad we did!

a somewhat hidden and lesser known gem in Ajuda. The garden is never too crowded and on week days you can pretty much visit it all by yourself. An increasingly good effort has been taken in the last years in its maintenance and the fountains are now clean and clear. A perfect place for a winter walk or to read a book under a tree in the summer. A large number of peafowl can be seen wandering around. There is a restaurant inside and a greenhouse for succulents and cacti, some of which are for sale.
Lovely, quiet place with stunning collection of plants. Great value
Love the gardens. Nature and trees. This garden is full of diversified plants. Come enjoy.
One of the best kept secret of Lisbon. A little bit hard to get (you will have to walk quite a bit from the public station and it is on top of a hill). So one might consider a taxi.

Love Vieira da Silva ever since discovering her work in Paris. 
BUT Disappointed with the organisation of the museum yesterday, not up to the Artist... museum closed for a refurbishment, nothing on the website to let us know so we spent precious time going to the museum just to be turned away.
I loved this  place because the paintings are very good and the history of Arpad Szenes and Siza Vieira is beautiful.
Must be visited. The work and life of the couple of painters Vieira da Silva and Árpád Szenes.
Installed in a old manufacturers of silk, this a good museum of painting from a artists couple.  Also has some very good temporary exhibitions.
This litle museum is a real gem!

Dolphin show is amazing! Such a chill vibe at the zoo. Not overly crowded. Some construction is being done so I didn't get to see the Lions or Cheetah. Also couldn't get close to the giraffes or elephants due to the construction.

Nice areas for the animals, and currently undergoing some maintenance so you can only see about 90% of the park. Kids love the little farm with all the miniature pigs, baby goats, sheep, donkey 🐄, etc....busy during the weekend but easy to visit during the week
Average zoo. In the middle of Lisbon and the animals are in smalls cages. One of the top attractions is the dolphin show and it is definitely worth it. The farm is good as well

The Lisbon Zoo is a great zoo. The dolphin show is amazing and the animals cages are cool as well. The price is a little bit overpriced and i feel like there are better zoos for less money. Maybe it was because of the weather and the season, but the park was quite dirty and looked a little bit abandoned as well as some of the attractions were shut down due to maintenance. All in all 4*.

Animals seemed relatively happy but most the zoo was closed or under construction which we weren't informed of. Big price to pay to enter a construction site! Chair lift thing is cool if not a little scary. Good range of animals and reasonably sized cages but there was no way at all for us to see the elephants from the ground due to construction and who knows what other animals we missed because of this. Peacocks running everywhere was cool. Also not ideal that all lunch outlets are outside the zoo so you need to get a pass out to access them.

I even do not have words, to describe it. 
I am adore of people,who make it possible to keep this place so cool, keep this animals in such beautiful condition,and show the beauty of nature for people. 
Especially thanks for exposition about the ocean pollution. It is a biggest issue after the global heating, everybody should to be informed about it.
I love you guys

The Aquarium is a little way away from the city centre so we were a bit dubious as to whether or not to make the journey on our short city break. However, as we love sea life we thought we’d give it a go and we are so thankful that we did!

The place was amazing with a huge tank making the centre focal point and 4 sub rooms themed around different points of the ocean. Highlights for us was definitely the otters who were really playful and we were lucky enough to be there at feeding time. 

If you love Sea life I would highly recommend including this in your itinerary!

Such a gem. A must in Lisbon. You can make a day of it.  My children loved it 5-8 yr olds. We saved some money and just paid for the permanent exhibition and it was more than enough. They were actually tired before it was over. If it's a super hot day, packing a bathing suit and change of clothes looked like a good idea to cool off. There are tons of fountains around the aquarium.

Place where Adults along with Kids will have a lot of fun. The place is not far from Lisbon centre, well connected by public transport. Has a big centre tank which is spectacular, you could spend hours looking at the variety of the species. I can imagine the difficulty in maintaining this place but I have no complaints. Even the restaurant has decent meal options, even for vegetarians.

The absolute BEST aquarium I have seen so far worldwide. They have an extremely big variety of species and the tanks are designed and decorated very liveable. I spent more than 3 hours in there and could have stayed a lot longer. 
The architecture of the whole building is fascinating as well as it is situated in a very modern part of Lisboa right by the sea side. 
If you are in Lisboa, I would absolutely recommend to visit the Oceanário! Really worth the spend

A highlights of a recent visit to Lisbon! From the history of tile making in Portugal to contemporary artworks inspired by a national art - we spent a couple of hours here. Didn't use the audioguide, but perhaps we should have done, as sometimes I hoped for more interpretation. 
A beautiful space for a museum, and some of the tile are incredibly detailed. The Chapel of St. Anthony is especially stunning. In the central courtyard, a conservator was visibly working through collections, which was nice to see. 
Also a nice leafy courtyard to have a coffee in after our visit.

We didn't have enough time to visit here enough! It is a very interesting and historical tiles museum.   Tiles are a great part of Lisbon's history. We only had 1 hour to visit and we needed at least two hours...plan a accordingly.

An excellent museum showing the history of tile making and usage in Portugal, from the times of the Moors, who introduced tile work to Portugal. There is a great history of taking ideas from the Italians and the Dutch, which contributed to the Portuguese style of tile making and use. The building was previously a religious building and you can how tiles were used. But I never realized how rich Portugal was... This is shown in the interior design of the chapel etc.
There are also displays of modern pottery and some very nice tea sets and kitchen pottery. The shop is a bit bare. They could have produced more interesting pieces of pottery to buy.
I would recommend downloading the app MNAz, which gives a lot of information about various exhibits in the museum. This available in English if needed... Which I used!
In the cafe I noticed that the barista did not wipe down the steam pipe, which was covered in dried milk. Not the best way to produce a decent cappuccino!

Incredible tile display, absolutely worth your time. Plenty of translations on the descriptions. I had read a couple of posts about the gift shop being closed for hours. I checked at the desk and sure enough, it closed from 12:30-2:00. We arrived around 11:00, so I purchased a couple of souvenirs before touring the museum.
Very impressive. Great welcome. Lots to see beside tiles. A bit more explanation with a book/guide would have been great

Fantastic place and it's a must visit. Confluence of all kind of foods. So many choices and there are options available for everyone. Food quality is great in all the shops. Seating arrangement is linear in central hall and on a busy evening it seems like a big feat going on ! We tried Asian lab, tartar ia and zero zero pizza, all of them were very satisfying. Don't miss it...

Our hotel desk suggested that we must come to this exciting market.  So we came one evening and were impressed immediately.  It is also known as the Time Out Market.

It was busy.  Noisy with people chatting, laughing and enjoying the evening with friends.

You can find gourmet food. Fish, meats, pizza, desserts cooked and prepare  by well known chefs and restaurateurs.   Lots of choices of wine and beer.  Booths are along the perimeter facing toward the centre of the big hall, which served as a fish market Many years ago.

Before buying, it would be good to walk around and see what's being offered.  On a busy night, it can be hard to get a seat.  Might be easier to find space at the tall tables in the long hallway, where you can stand and eat.  People seat or stand close to each other and so it is easy to start chatting with your neighbour.

Highly recommended. Don't miss it. It is an experience.

Super popular market for various cuisines and wines. Definitely try the port flights. Evening bands are fun as well. Can try all the Portuguese delicacies in one place! A little pricey compared to the rest of the city, but worth the experience.

Bought by Time Out, the magazine, this market become a center that offers many restaurants and large common area to seat and dine under one roof.
The concept is not new, and exist in many other cities.
Large offering, slightly on the expensive side.
If you are looking for something typical, this, is not the place to visit.
If you are looking instead for good food, often associated with growing chef from the local scene, or international restaurant, it’s the place to choose.

The place it’s mostly crowded all the time, and can be tricky to find a sport to accommodate more than two person also why, after eating, the trays are left on the table and it took more than a while to clean them due to a cleaning team that, it’s clearly understaffed.

Variety of cuisines. Buzzing  from 10 am until midnight . Live band in the evening. About if not close to a thousand people dinning at any one time. Easy to move about. Delicious food. Take a tour round first to see what you fancied to meet with your pocket. Very efficient to prepare food. You're given 15 minutes but your buzzer goes off within 10.

Me and my wife had a most enjoyable meal in Cafe Buenos Aires this evening. Service was friendly and food was excellent. We had spring rolls and hummus to start but highlight was the excellent salad main courses. I had asparagus and poached egg salad and my wife had aubergine and brie filo pastry salad. Dessert was also excellent - fried pineapple and coconut ice cream. Restaurant vibe / atmosphere was also really nice. Would recommend.

A small and cozy place, but a bit loud. The steak was very good, but a bit more cooked then I asked for. Service were friendly and very quick.

They dont accept Visa or MasterCard
One of the best Argentinian spots in Lisbon. Old decoration with some Lisbon and Argentinian history, cozy and great for  having a dinner with friends.
Perfect Argentinian steak ! Flank steak is a must have. Also home made pasta with mushrooms. Week wine selection is perfect. Place is cosy and unique. Staff is the best!

Great restaurant. Great food, great ambiance!  Went there 4 times now, always good, nice staff, great food. It is, by far, the best place I went to in Lisbon, for 2 consecutive years. Congratulations! Tip: you must taste the meat pastries and as desert the chocolate cake.

Best restaurant we’ve been to in Lisbon (and we have been to a lot of great spots). Food was excellent and staff were very friendly. Would 100% recommend. Very authentic and great seafood! Kid friendly.

Super fantastic place. Has the feel of a simple, family run restaurant. The servers are super friendly and take great care of your tablet we recently celebrate a birthday here and had a fantastic meal. My favorite dish is this seafood mix with some bit of coffee in the cream sauce. Yum.

I had to search for this place and was not disappointed when I found it! I didn't realize the dish I ordered had milk (I'm severely allergic) and the lovely waiter helped me choose a new dish that was safe to eat. The food was absolutely delicious and the restaurant was full of locals - exactly what I was looking for! I'll be coming back next time I'm in Lisbon!!
Very nice food with lots of locals and good quality! Definitely come back! Prices are also decent and good! Love this family local feeling! Nothing else just good food!
Great spot with actual good Portuguese food! Staff are friendly and funny. Great value for money. Big portions. Highly recommend if you wanna taste of good food for low prices.
Great little restaurant, amazing codfish and pork dishes. Service can be a bit on the slow side during busy times. Highly recommended!
Food is ok but the service is awful. Recommend to avoid - much better places in the surroundings
Chocolate tarta was delightful. Expensive though... 6 EUR.
Superb for a quick lunch great alternative menu.
Stylish, modern but really slow and expensive for what it is. Paid around 20 people per person for a brunch. Employees are pretty slow even it friendly.
Fabulous local restaurant, friendly owner who also waits the tables. Delicious food, unpretentious and casual. Highly recommended.
Get the cod and cream. Owners favourite. Nice guy, good atmosphere, great food, generous portions. YUM!
Family owned & made, wholesome local food - so glad we stumbled upon this place. Cannot wait to come back. The owner is lovely. So much food, we all have food comas!
Fabulous place. Very nice and friendly owner. Meals wonderful. I recommend monkfish with rice and octopus. Amazing. We will come back for sure.
Nice authentic place with great food and huge plates!

Overall, okay restaurant and a bit pricey. I was recommended this restaurant by a tour guide. 
1) Appetizer - crab meat. (Around 7.50 EURO). Would not recommend. It basically tasted like crab mayo salad. It was decent with bread but I was hoping for more fresh crab meat versus crab meat that tasted something I could get from a cheap supermarket.
2) Entree #1 - Pork Leg. (Around 16.50 EURO). Pretty good! Juicy and super tender. The skin was crunchy and flavorful. However there was A LOT of fat surrounding the meat.  Would recommend. -  Came with oven baked potato chips were tasty and addicting.
3) Entree #2 - sirloin steak. (Around 15.50 EURO). would not recommend. It was small and super flat. A little too well done. And was drowned in a tasty sauce. However, if a steak is drowned in sauce, it basically means it isn't good. - it came with fries that we're regular French fries similar to McDonald's (but not as salted).

Loved visiting this place with my family, great place for lunch and an excellent atmosphere. There's a varied menu and something for everyone. Child friendly, they have highchairs and changing facilities. Wasn't a fan of tarter items being out on the table without asking though.

Overall I had a great experience, with both enjoyable food and wonderful service. The server helped me decide my meal (shredded cod) which came very quickly and even gave me a sample of Bohemia to try before I ordered it. I almost forgot my umbrella and another server returned it to me. I would visit again! Thank you to Pedro from "My Chill Lisbon" for recommending.

This place has a lovely old world feel about it. The wall murals are beautiful and the fact that there is a fish weighing station in the middle of the restaurant is pretty cool. I recommend you try the prego here along with a pint of beer. The yellow beans/peas(?) they serve with the beer are epic. I wish I had asked them what they were and bought some as a souvenir.
Historical restaurant.. nothing special though.. pretty expensive for the decent quality.. it might be better at lunch with the set menus..
They were open on christmas night!

On vous sert une entrée "typique" que l'on vous impose quasiment. Soles et côtelettes ne sont pas disponibles. La salade de tomates à 3.50€ vous est facturé 6.00 € et les tomates ont aucun goût. Et cerise sur le gâteau le pain est payant (1€) et le beurre aussi (4€).
Adresse à éviter

Abbiamo mangiato piatti di pesce e di carne, ci è sembrato tutto buono.
In realtà eravamo entrati per fare aperitivo con un buon porto, ma poi il proprietario è stato così gentile che ci siamo fermati anche a cena...
Aucun intérêt, addition incompréhensible et plats très simple, seul les rabatteurs sont performant. A fuire vite !

One of Columbia's Best restaurants, with fantastic local food and a beautiful dining room. the Pizzas are a specialty, but I recommend their steaks all the time. Great view of the other side of the river.

Wonderful as always, innovative cocktails, fantastic flavors in the food. Had grilled Cobia and it was perfect. Can't go wrong with the house made ice cream and cookie desert.  Try the Makers Mark flavor!
I cannot say enough good about this restaruant. Not only is it amazingly delicious but the staff is wonderful. Every time we have gone they have been friendly and attentive.

The food is excellent. The kitchen always turns out great stuff. The lamb mac & cheese is killer. Do yourself a favor and try it. The cocktails have always been stand out, and the wine list is solid. This is definitely one of my favorite places to eat in general, and for sure my first choice in the Columbia area.
Food and service was amazing and intimate. I love that every ingredient is found locally, and chef turns it into something amazing. I will be back for sure.
A fantastic meal, with the flavor of a native land, to kill the longing for the flavors of home when you are in Lisbon.
The food was excellent and the service really good. I asked for the picanha option and the plate had 3 slices
Good food, nice quantity and amazing service. Reminded me of the brazilian food from my hometown
Very nice old syle good food good price
Place old and not inviting, but food really good, with a real Brasilian taste. Price very good, service fast but not really interactive.
Boa comida
já fui e voltei várias vezes, sempre bem tratado e sem nada de negativo a acrescentar. Aconselho para quebrar rotinas
Boa comida
Todo buenisimo y cantidad. Dejad hueco para los postres. Los precios un poco altos, sobre todo los vinos.

Small bar where it alwyas seems to be party-time. One of the most lively places-to-be in the Barrio Alto. I reckon that the two tempting ladies behind the bar contribute to the bustle and lively atmosphere. And last but not least there is nice live music. So, if you want to have a good time, come to the Arroz Doce!
Pub with live music. Musician was really great with charming voice. Drinks was good but nothing special. If you left your bra you get free drink - They hanging them over the bar Bleh...

Favorite bar in bairro alto. Great live music, fare price and there's a guy how works there, Cristian, that I'm still trying to figure that out if he's the nicest guy I ever meet or the smart one. The place ALWAYS have nice and beautiful people and I always meet a lot of interesting people there. It's such a very good place to know people and just have a nice night. Everytime that I have to choose a place to go with people from all Couchsurfing and go with a group, I chose there. No doubts.
The shots are awesome
Wonderful live music!

It is a great place for either lunch or dinner. The views from the restaurant are amazing, both during the day or the night, but I prefer during the night. The food here is really good, one Michelin star restaurants are usually good and this is no exception. The service is also very nice. Of course it is not cheap, but the food is definitely worth it.

Incredible meal, really enjoyable experience for a Michelin rated place. Beautifully paced meal, excellent sommelier and extremely accommodating of dietary requirements. Would go back in a heartbeat (and I am very spoiled and have been lucky enough to go to some super places)
An Amazing place with a great combination of style and quality products. Service was good. Wine and food peculiar.

My best experience so far in Lisbon, I highly appreciated the lobster and a bottle of wine from the Dao region. Service is perfect and I've nothing to complain about. If I have to look for a defect the oil served at the beginning may not be up to the job but it is not a problem.

Delicious. We enjoyed a tasting menu, and the chef easily—and deliciously—accommodated the two pescatarians in our group. There was a slight hiccup with the wine—we were brought a different bottle than what I thought I had ordered—but it proved to be both quite good and less expensive, so I count that as a win.
It's really awesome.
Best place to see Aswan
Beautiful View of Aswan City and Mesmerizing Sunset
Marvellous view
Fantastic

Clean room with all amenities that you would expect of a 5 star hotel. Hotel staff were courteous and certainly helpful during our stay. Cafe staff also remembered the drink I prefer in the morning. Kudos for that. Meeting facilities were adequate. They have a big and modern gym.

Beautiful hotel. Comfy rooms but street music can continue till early morning hours. Hotel staff very friendly & helpful.  Restaurant & its staff was fantastic; breakfast buffet was amazing, dinner was equally great with nice selection of appetizers, entrees, & dessert (try apple pie/galette with cinnamon ice cream, yum).
Great hotel, very friendly personal. We enjoyed our stay there. Once you're there you need to try the roof top bar. Fantastic view...

The best hotel, the staff is so nice, polite and very helpful, an impeccable service.  
The room is very clean and the hotel in general is #amazing.  
We got a lovely surprise to our room for our anniversary.
Tivoli is totally worth it!
Freekin' awesome. Find out more tonight after dinner. Lisbon is unbelievable . The city centre looks old and worn but still beautiful and fun to explore.
